column1: #Text=Sintered polycrystalline samples were prepared using Ce pieces (99.9%), Pd shot, powder or sponge (99.9%) and red P powder or grains (99.9%).
#Text=We used CePd3 or CePd2, prepared by arc melting the constituent elements (Ce pieces and Pd shot) in an argon atmosphere, as a precursor in the solid-state reaction.
#Text=Crushed CePd3 (CePd2), Pd and P with the molar ratios Ce:Pd:P listed in Table 1 were homogeneously mixed together.
#Text=The pelletized sample was reacted in an evacuated quartz tube at 900 °C for 3 days.
#Text=All products were characterized by powder X-ray diffraction (XRD) analysis.
#Text=Electron probe microanalysis (EPMA) was performed to identify the composition of sample #1.
